pros: Loved it there, great place to work
cons: People could be bullies and no one cared

review_title: Management are very kind but caseload and workload is high
job_title: Speech Language Pathologist in Dayton, OH
pros: They are willing to invest and support you in continuing to grow your skills. They look after their therapists and defend and support them. During Covid, DCH was extremely supportive of employees With 10 hour days, you get one weekday off entirely.
cons: 10 hour days with a new patient every 30 minutes, and only one 30-minute lunch (which you are expected to work through), and one 30 minute do-not -book time to catch up on everything and make phone calls. I imagine this is a problem consistent with all pediatric outpatient rehab therapy, so I don’t think it’s necessarily a fair criticism of Dayton Childrens, however that is the reality of working there. If no patients cancel or no-shows, you end up seeing 18 patients a day, and many of those patients are on an every-other week schedule and you end up with a large caseload. You have to arrive early and stay late, many times very late, because completing everything for a session within 30 minutes is not possible to do consistently (treat, educate, clean/disinfect, document and bill) AAC is a difficult specialty, with significantly extra work, time commitment and stress, and once you agree to it they never let you stop being an AAC specialist.

review_title: Wonderful place to work and grow your talent and skills
job_title: Medical Staff Coordinator in Dayton, OH
pros: Family Orientated, friendly work environment and they really understand that it is so important to be able to take care of ourselves mentally and physically by providing the resources needed to maintain selfcare and work/life balance.
cons: Stronger intra communication between departments and managers.

review_title: Low pay but there's a reason they get away with it
pros: I took a pay cut to come here from a local adult level one trauma hospital. And I would do it again in a heartbeat. I don't like that I make less money but honestly my mental health is worth it and it's a great place to work. I enjoy coming to work every day and I enjoy what I do. Love the people I work with. Fortunately I can afford to make less than at another hospitals.
cons: I do wish their pay was more competitive. Then it would be a perfect job.

pros: The patient's and families we interact with daily.
cons: Poor pay,No room for advancement, no bonus, no raises, management is lacking or inexperienced. Christmas time we recieve cups, or blankets. Things I'll never use. The money spent on all of that I'd rather of just got a $20 gift card. They tend to hire management just to fill holes. If they would concentrate on spending the time,money and effort on the staff who are putting effort they may not have such a high turnover constantly.

review_title: Good pay, but unsure if it is worth it
job_title: Crisis Assessment Specialist in Dayton, OH
pros: - many open positions - competitive pay - fast paced - great benefits - shift differential
cons: - micromanagement - frequent changes in policies/processes - poor relationship with other departments - stressful work environment - vicarious trauma - staff are being injured by patients - little support from management - not enough staffing

pros: Dayton Children's cares about their employees and patients. They are flexible, supportive, understanding, & offer some of the best benefits around! They understand family needs & work hard to make sure the work-life balance stays even.
cons: I don't have anything negative to say! Love where I work!

job_title: Clinical nutrition lab tech in Dayton, OH
pros: Great company and environment, good benefits
cons: There are a lot of people underpaid

job_title: Senior Medical Social Worker in Dayton, OH
pros: The Department has good resources to help families who are in need. Shift differential makes the pay much more competitive. There is adequate PTO. It is nice that we can be off most holidays; there is a good work/life balance and our boss doesn't expect us to read/respond to emails when we're off. The senior social work supervisor is very supportive and kind. There is great communication about changes in the organization. Public Safety accessibility increases sense of safety at the hospital.
cons: Sometimes we are expected to practice outside of our scope of practice, like determining custody or visitation rules. We have to deal with substantial amount of death, abuse and neglect, with very little break in between intense cases. There is poor acknowledgement from senior management of the demands of our jobs. Our department has a poor working relationship with CSB who regularly complains about things you should have done when it was their job to do it in the first place. There is a high expectation that we are also assessing the entire family/sibling set as opposed to just the patient right in front of us, which is different from any other environment. We are expected to be able to ensure the safety of any child--including ones at home.

review_title: Nice entry job or retirement job
job_title: Public Safety Officer in Dayton, OH
pros: I retired from my local police department and decided i still wanted to serve so i applied at Childrens hospital. I work a shift that i dont really see the director or chief much but I do work a lot of overtime so i speak to all shifts. This place isn't bad to start or bad to retire and work. It can be busy but it also can be slow. We get compensated VERY WELL for what we do and you are never forced to stay over for overtime if you don't want it. The health benefits are amazing and the matching 401k isnt bad either.
cons: To much childish gossip especially outside our department. We need more backing from our CEO when force is needed.

pros: Engaged Leadership, Strong tie to mission and vision. Easy to connect to purpose when you walk by the dragonflyer and hear kids' voices
cons: Healthcare inherently comes with challenges

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Dayton, OH

cons: Pay is often not as high as at adult hospitals.

pros: Great mission-driven organization with wonderful employee benefits!

Work life balance is awful for IT employees mandatory on call and the staff rotates often enough you will most likely be on call more times a year than you've been told. Many members of upper level staff are demanding and rude. Same goes for the doctors. Lots of nepotism. Very little room to move up in IT. Partially due to the nepotism.

job_title: Executive Director Tech in Dayton, OH
pros: Children's really is a fantastic place to work at, and it is very rewarding. Management going all the way up to the president does their best to show appreciation and care for all employees, and they try to give us as many resources as they possible can to be successful in our line of work. Everyone you work with will feel like family.
cons: We are a very busy hospital, that's a given. Being short on staff makes it difficult to run this place, but like I said above, management does their best to work out these situations, like closing down sections that we can't staff and they even work on the floors themselves to help out as well.

pros: The people working here for the most part, LOVE their jobs, it's a cheerful work environment, and they offer tuition reimbursement. They've gotten a lot better with helping people advance their careers and find better jobs within the hospital.
cons: Pay is below average. Not very flexible with schedules. Poor management (certain areas). A revolving door of new people because no one stays. Seems to always be understaffed.

pros: The benefits were generally considered to be excellent.

review_title: Generally positive, COVID safety precautions are lacking
pros: Friendly coworkers except for one department, great training, accomodating of needs/flexible.
cons: Several ways response to covid could be safer. No testing offered without a "confirmed response." No n95 offered without a major hassle with employee health and even then it isnt the best kind. no reasonable allowance for sick days to keep potentially sick employees from coming in. having employees sign a "keeps safe pledge" instead of addressing these issues. meetings where doctors just dont wear masks. c19+ patients kept doors down from severely immunocompromised patients. no changing masks in and out of patient rooms except when required by factors of pt disease. rounding inside c19+ pts rooms. foot dragging for months about allow some groups to perform teleservices w/o any legal or billing reason to hold it up--purely an internal hospital issue

pros: Great work environment if you care about children and enjoy building relationships with people across disciplines.  Very friendly people, good technology for general working conditions; great technology for patients.

review_title: False hopes, horrible communication, too political: hospital wide
pros: There are great employees you work with but we are all in this struggle together dealing with the same pain and grief and stress that is listed in the cons.
cons:
-Probably the worst I’ve ever experienced at any job when it comes to communication. This is not just per department on a manager and director level but all the way up and hospital wide. 
-Don’t let these reviews fool you. There is a high turnover rate. People are leaving in flocks and are completely over the lies, the false hopes, the lack of compassion and understanding this place has, if I were to describe this place as an employer in one word, it would be: TOXIC
-Managers and directors fall into one of three categories: 1: they stand by their employees under them and do the right think but eventually the hospital fires them. 2: They are fired for being a good manager or director and for standing for their employees but that’s not the hospitals Prerogative. 3: They conform and join the dark side of upper leadership, leaving and abandoning their own employees under them and leading to an even more toxic environment and lack of trust from all the employees and resulting in the high turn over rate.

pros: There's great pay and benefits
cons: Difficult to advance within the company

cons: Due to it being a smaller company there is not as much room for growth.

job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Dayton, OH
pros: Helping kids and their families
cons: Sad stories occasionally, but a lot of good ones too

pros: Great management, room to grow, taking care of children is a true gift!
cons: I do not have any cons.

pros: Dayton Children's is great because of the attitudes of compassion and collaboration in every employee. Prior to working here, I would work for about five years and then move on to another employer. Being firmly in middle age, I have had a lot of employers. I just started my 10th year, and I believe Dayton Children's will be the last place I ever work. The people who work here love their jobs as much as they love the kids we work with. I have never been anywhere that the employees all see themselves as part of a team, each one willing to go above and beyond to give exceptional care to every patient, compassion to every family and support to every co-worker. From the bottom-up or the top-down, the attitude is the same. I cannot imagine ever leaving here.
cons: The location is not my ideal as I have to drive a bit to get here, but it is totally worth it.

review_title: It's an okay place to work
pros: Working with the children, making a difference in a child's life. I have been a nurse for a little over a year. Most staff is caring and genuinely loves the kids. Very competent.
cons: Benefits are terrible. For an individual, the deductible for healthcare is over 3 grand. Also the pay is about 2 dollars less per hour then other area hospitals. Night and weekend diffs are a little lower as well. Chronic short staffing of nurses. Management fails to recognize employees for a good job but only harps on the negative. Also, they want you to continue your education or certifications but offers no help in paying for them and no incentive (salary increase?) to receive them.

pros: Excellent care for children, good location in downtown Dayton.  Affordable parking garage. Hospital accepts Medicaid and offers financial assistance for hardship cases.
cons: I worked in a department where some of the older employees and the medical directors where verbally very abusive toward some of the new staff. Little to no room to grow unless you are the directors favorite.  Directors favorites quit positions and get rehired behind closed doors into the same position but with higher step. I witnessed how some people where called into unexpected meetings with the director and bullied by him/her. Complains to management and HR are swept under the rug and not taken seriously.  Some people walked out of their positions because they could not take the abuse anymore. Would not recommend to work there.  Pay ceiling was massively lowered in the last 6 month for clerical staff.  Don't let the word "magnet recognized" fool you. Benefits:  Offered health insurance is bad with a very high deductible. No paid holidays. You are required to take PTO. Sick leave equals PTO.

pros: The pros are a family-friendly environment where employees go above and beyond to care for kids. My co-workers are some of the most talented I have ever worked with in my 20 year career. We have freedom and flexibility to be creative. We have the power to make the right decisions. And we get to have the honor to care for our region's children in incredible ways.
cons: The cons are we are moving at a rapid pace to transform care. So there are times when we put systems in place, but they aren't 100% solid before we move on to the next thing. Health care is changing so fast that it's sometimes hard to keep up!

pros: I love the passion that runs through this place. We have been expanding quickly and adding new, amazing physicians as well as new technologies. The company cares so much about its employees that we actually just did a large compensation study to make sure that all of our salaries compared to market and we also recently added a lot of great additions to our non-medical benefits, including 6 weeks of PAID maternity/paternity leave, Short Term Disability that is covered at 100% for the first 90 days AND tuition reimbursement of up to $5,250 annually. We are also creating career ladders (especially for our nursing staff) for professional growth. Our CEO, Debbie Feldman, is very visible and approachable, which is not always the case in organizations. You can find her eating lunch in our cafeteria or just walking the halls and she is always smiling and saying hello. The atmosphere here is phenomenal.
cons: I really don't have any negative things to say.

pros: Dayton Children's is unlike any place that I have ever worked.  The mission is clear and the passion for great care close to home comes through in every decision made.  This is not your mother's Dayton Children's - things are changing rapidly and improvements are being made daily to create value for our patients
cons: Dayton Children's is in a very competitive environment from a recruitment standpoint as there as several players in the market looking for talented people to fill our vacancies.  Dayton Children's is constantly evaluating our positions to ensure that we are competitive.

review_title: Clueless Management in Patient Accounts at Tech Town
pros:
Work/life balance
Good work environment
cons:
Management does not know the job at all and you are left with no questions answered 
Hires in at a significantly higher rate than people that have been there for years 
Can’t do job effectively only half the people actually work and management can’t help because they don’t know anything 
Management walks around all day and gossips about their employees 
No career ladders every move is lateral and no compensation

pros: I have only worked here for a short time; however, it has been a WONDERFUL experience! The leadership team listens to employees, is very personable and approachable.   At a previous local employer, most leadership opportunities were only available to RNs; however, Children's supports individual growth from all disciplines.  Employees seem happy and most are very warm and welcoming!  Employees seem proud to work at Children's and call it "a great place to work!"  Children's recently changed their benefits package, and it is EXCEPTIONAL!  I feel very proud to work for Dayton Children's Hospital!
cons: -Parking can be a challenge at this time (due to influx of employee hiring).

review_title: Great hospital, not so great treatment of employees
pros: DCH is a wonderful place with wonderful employees who genuinely care about the work that they do.
cons: Some areas reek of cronyism whereby 10% of the employees then get to do 90% of the work while others slide by without contributing.  While there is desire to grow, there is no desire to put forth proper resources so that growth is manageable.  If you aren't a clinician (i.e., MD or RN) you are treated as a second-class citizen -- they even get special name badges.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Dayton, OH
pros: Benefits are getting better. Wgen the majority has a major gripe management listens. They are also doing a better job at work /life balance. If you don't like one shift or position it is fairly easy to move to another shift or floor. Thorough orientation which you are gonna need.
cons: If you are trying to get a job here as pool they are really restricting what hours you can work and are always putting more restrictions on you. Some of the floor are talking about going to every other weekend working for new employees instead of every 3rd

pros: There are a lot of long term employees here which says so much about us.  We are finishing a new 8-story patient care tower.  It has state of the art technology that you will not find anywhere else in the country.  Why would anyone in the surrounding area take their children to another hospital when we have great care right here?  I travel 45 min to and from work everyday because I like my job and am proud of Dayton Childrens. People come from all over the country to see some of our doctors.  We have added many new subspecialties so that our families do not have to travel far to get the care they need.
cons: I do not have anything negative to say!

job_title: Senior EEG Technologist in Dayton, OH
pros: Really well run hospital, with very patient oriented structure. I came in August of 2017 from another part of the country and my salary is comparable to what it was on the East coast, but the cost of living is much less. Positive and enjoyable hospital to work in. Physicians are top of the line, wonderful pediatric specialists, who sped countless hours caring for the patients in their charge.  Happy to be a member of this team; its a very positive experience
cons: My manager is new to management and probably needs much more training, but being a senior tech myself I can ride out her omissions.

job_title: Medical Office Specialist in Dayton, OH
pros: I really enjoyed working with the doctors and the children. Children’s is a very fast pace job so you never are bored and  the work days go by really quick. I always enjoyed working at the hospital and making a difference of someone’s life.
cons: A very caddy workplace.  They allow coworkers treat other coworkers horrible. I was threatened with a fist at my face and nothing was done.  Even if you had witnesses they still do nothing.  I was bullied and harassed everyday.

pros: Very helpful staff. Great benefits. Tuition Reimbursement.
cons: No uniform allowance. Scheduling is done last minute.

pros: Having worked in a much larger pediatric hospital for 10 years, I thought coming here would be a huge adjustment.  But the "vibe" here is so great!  I felt supported and accepted from day one and have never seen such a positive and friendly atmosphere in a hospital, ever.   Coming here was the best career decision I have made yet!!
cons: Haven't found any yet.  I'll let you know...

pros:
Patient centered care.
Small enough to still care about employees
Pulling in very well known Providers which is growing our business
I love being a part of this organization while we are in the process of building the business.  Just watching the way the employees continue to ensure the patients and families always come first makes me proud to be employed by DCH.
cons: With growth comes growing pains & we are feeling them, however this too brings out the best in the winners and shows what an amazing team we have to work with.

pros: Everyone at Dayton Children's is so respectful and team oriented. There is really a community at this hospital. I love this job and I have never felt better taken care of in a workplace. My team leaders and supervisors want to make sure that I am fully prepared to take care of my patients as well as myself. Plus the kids are always so cute.
cons: There is not much wiggle room to move up or be promoted. Most of the head staff has been here for years and there are rarely openings for those positions.

review_title: Great place that's making many improvements
job_title: Health Information Management in Dayton, OH
pros:
1. Great coworkers
2. Great management in the department I work in. They are willing to listen and help whenever possible.
3. Dental insurance premiums
4. Building a new patient tower and making many improvements to catch up to the times that will be finished in 2017
5. Better tasting coffee than starbucks!
6. Lots of training provided
7. Smaller hospital than Nationwide or Cincinnati which makes it easy to get around quickly
cons:
1. Lower pay than bigger hospitals
2. Changed to high deductible insurance plan

pros: The hospital takes care of their employees, and you are not just a number. They have great benefits and they acknowledge everyone no matter your job title. The staff is all very welcoming to new employees, and working with the children is amazing.
cons: I honestly cannot think of any, I am a newer employee of only 2 months, and it has been a wonderful experience for me.

pros: I have the privilege of working with very dedicated and passionate physicians and nurses. We feel supported by the mission and values of the organization as well as the commitment to safety and quality. The family focused care is evident.
cons: The rapid growth and constant change makes it hard to adapt. Some of the change is truly necessary but some is reactive and not well thought out. The end goal is pretty consistent but the processes to get there are not.

pros: People are friendly and kind.  Those I work with really do make you feel part of a team. Lots of growth!
cons: Upper management seems out of touch sometimes.

pros: Dayton Children's is a wonderful hospital to work for because not only are you part of life-changing work for our community of pediatric patients, you also get rewarded well for what you do!  Great new compensation and benefits plans are the added perk!  Plus, working for a child-focused organization is a delight!
cons: A lot of quick changes within the past few years but in the end it will be the most beneficial for the hospital and the patients served.

pros: Small hospital where the ceo, CNO and other upper management leaders will stop and talk with you in the hallways. They will even come around to help, hold babies or pass out snacks during our busy season. Flexible hours. Decent pay. The brand new patient care tower opening in July is amazing.  Our patients are the cutest around!
cons: Pay could be better, but it's not bad

pros: Benefits, located in downtown area of Dayton.
cons: I worked in an department where admin staff made fun of their patients and families appearance.   The management was horrible.  Director acted like he was untouchable and "sitting next to God".  Bullying the staff by the director, staff bullying staff within department and other employees from other departments and  was on daily schedule. Bringing the issue to HR was a joke.  It was just swept under the rug.  Dayton Children's might look like a great place to work but it is not.

pros: The benefits and pay are great. The social circles are tight and the atmosphere is fun.
cons: The amount of Medicaid patients is tremendous, though this means we are helping our community more, it also sets us up for patient overload during cold and flu season.

pros: I love my job! Dayton Children's is small enough that it still feels like family but provides world class care you expect for every child. I work with an amazing group of people. Always see smiling faces and there's nothing better than working with kids!
cons: Growing pains of construction, but it is worth it!

job_title: Family Partnership Coordinator in Dayton, OH
pros: Friendly staff, encouraging Supervisors, Managers and Directors. Everyone is on the same page and here to care for the children and families. I would not want to work anywhere else as this is family and everyday you meet someone new who is just as excited about their job as you are about yours. I truly love coming to work!
cons: Do not have anything negative to say.

pros:
Leadership engaged and accessible
Good compensation
Passionate about Kids and careing for the whole family
If you want to work and make differience, this is the place. You'll see it every day.
Get to see therapy dogs in the lobby nearly every day.
Therapy ponies in the lobby and kids get so excited, and adults.
cons: None - best place I've every worked

pros: I feel the employees and leadership  here at Dayton Children's has a priority for excellent patient care.  I love how the focus is on us asking our patient's what they need versus a medical team who tells them what they need.  Great and inspiring place to work!
cons: I love working here and I don't have any cons.

pros: Great mission and vision. Growing and expanding. Making a difference in our community and in the lives of children.  Great benefits!
cons: With growth comes a lot of hard work and many initiatives.

pros: Smiling faces! Working with children and making them smile.  This is a great place to work and a lot of awesome changes are taking place!  You will want to be part of this team.
cons: Right now there is a lot of construction and some growing pains, but the outcome will be amazing! Be patient.

pros: To help family's in there time of need, to give them and our fellow employee a smile.
cons: Some times the loss of our children is more then what we can handle.

pros: Enjoyed working with the providers responsible for the well being of the patients.
cons: IT managers promote hostility and team fragmentation in their management practices. They do not deal with issues of discrimination preferring instead to get rid of whistleblowers instead of dealing with unethical and illegal practices that are reported to management and Human Resources.

review_title: DCH - A Great Place to Work
pros: DCH provides state of the art care while still treating each patient as a unique individual. Management has recruited specialists and developed new service lines to further support the health care needs of our community.
cons: There are no downsides. In fact, I have recruited family members to work here.

review_title: I like working at Dayton Children's
job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Dayton, OH
pros: The staff is very friendly! There are always extra shifts available to work overtime. Everyone is very competent and knows what they are doing. A great overall environment.
cons: They are sometimes understaffed but I really have no complaints.

pros:
Great Benefits - Maternity/Paternity Leave, Life Insurance, Medical Insurance, 401-K, Wage compensation and Well-being initiatives.
Wonderful Environment -   Good caring co-workers, great management team, good communication, great mission and good work/life balance.
cons: Construction challenges due to our constant growth over the last few years. Parking on campus/travel to main campus.

pros:
This is an extremely busy pediatric ER. As a PCA you get to do SOO much. This is a great position for someone in nursing school as you learn a lot

The other PCAs,nurses and doctors are all outstanding
cons: Low pay compared to other hospitals in the area

pros: Bringing joy to a child who is sick will be the hardest part but the most rewarding.
cons: Shows favortism,  unwilling to help  accommodate needs of certain employees

pros: Small enough hospital that communication is good, working together is great, salary is good, benefits are good; not much I can say negatively. Really enjoy it here.
cons: Often shortstaffed in offices.  Some office staff seem stressed from being understaffed.

pros: Dayton Children's truly cares about its mission to care for kids. You see it in everything that happens both inside and outside the hospital. It is a joy and a pleasure to get to work for Dayton Children's!
cons: Strong competition with other children's hospitals in Ohio.

job_title: Lab Staff Assistant in Springboro, OH
pros: Great environment, lovely people, the patients are amazing. Teamwork and accountability
cons: Like any place to work for there is always room to improve. no cons for working here tho it is a great place

pros: Excellent facilities, salary, and benefits. Inspiring mission to help children.
cons: Sets very high standards for performance, this could actually help with personal growth

review_title: Most awesome place to work hands down!
job_title: Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist in Dayton, OH
pros: Everyone is dedicated to the care and wellbeing of the pediatric patient and it is evident upon entering the building.
cons: It's a 45 minute drive to work :/

pros: Not many positives in my time there.
cons: Everything. Management was rude, they were unable to ever be present when they were needed. When management was present, they were demanding and belittling.

pros: An updated benefits package; a new tower to work in; a new Culinary Kitchen to eat in with healthy food options; working with children is amazing!
cons: We are growing fast. Desk space is limited. With the new tower, I am sure this will improve.

review_title: Dayton Children's is an excellent place to work!
pros: Flexible sick/vacation time, goals are attainable, the organization is mission-driven, and working hard to help all kids in the Miami Valley.
cons: Parking- but is getting exercise every day really a con?

review_title: ER Nurse at Dayton Children’s Hospital. Great Hospital
pros: Love working with kids. I believe people that work there really care about the patients and the care they are providing.
cons: Lower pay than the other hospitals.

pros: I am convinced that the best people in health care work at Dayton Childrens, it has such a warm welcoming family atmosphere.  There is no place better. By far the best job I've ever had.
cons: Parking is a little difficult.

pros: Dayton Children's Hospital is always such a heart warming place where parents feel save bringing their child here.
cons: Some of the changes they have made seem to not be the best changes and make it a little harder to work there.

pros: Outstanding care for kids, progressive, super engaged employees.  I have worked here for 32 years and have loved every minute!
cons: None that I can think of

job_title: Patient Account Specialist in Dayton, OH
pros:
Excellent Benefits
PTO 
Flexibility
Great Co- Workers
Friendly Atmosphere
cons:
location
and could provide more in depth training

review_title: Best Career choice i have ever made...
pros:
Great Pay
Great work environment
Plenty of staff
very positive coworkers and management
management listens and works close with employees
cons: I honestly have no cons to say about DCH

pros: Excellent benefits including paid maternity leave, self scheduling of 12 hour shifts/3days a week, mangers are easy to go to
cons: Nothing comes to mind that is of a negative manner!

review_title: Trying hard to compete...sometimes too hard.
pros: Employees support the mission, vision and values.
cons: Dysfunctional senior leadership team, lots of politics to try and navigate.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Dayton, OH
pros: Dayton children's is a great place to work. Great co-workers and everyone has a real love for what they do.
cons: Management is not always professional. Does not handle situations professionally.

pros: Great pay, benefit package, school funding, employee engagement. Amazing managers and co-workers, clean environment all around great place to work!!
cons: I have no complaints, I love my job!!

job_title: Executive Director RN in Dayton, OH
pros: Flexible schedule; Good team work;
cons: Hard to switch shifts; low pay compared to other area hospitals; hard to move up within company; poor inter-facility work flow; low incentives to keep employees;

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Dayton, OH
pros: The community was very supportive, coworkers were great, and management was always ready to help with issues.
cons: The pay could be higher, but you know what you will get upfront.

review_title: Does not care about employee experience
pros: The benefits recently changed, insurance coverage and tuition reimbursement.
cons: Management is in talent acquisition mode and does not look at where people and their talents can actually fit to most benefit an organization. They are hiring in over-qualified people to do grunt labor, and they are going to lose out on a huge talent pool because of it.

pros:
It is well staffed
Great benefits
Flexible, self-scheduling
Great work environment
Wonderful staff and management
Competitive Pay
cons: It is a relatively small hospital

job_title: Public Safety Officer in Dayton, OH
pros: Great salary and benefits. Professional and clean working environment. Opportunity to help children.
cons: None I can thing of.

pros: Making a difference in the lives of children, high job satisfaction
cons: I won't be getting rich here

pros: Most coworkers are nice and easy to get along with, but they can't keep the "good" workers. Retention is not goog at all.
cons: Manager and Supervisors are rude and obnoxious. Like to take credit for ideas and sork they DON'T perform. If you like a hostile work environment, then this Security Department is the place to work.

pros: Dayton Children's is a friendly place to work.  A lot of positivity in this hospital!
cons: None for clinics. I work in a clinic and love it!

job_title: Network Support Analyst in Dayton, OH
pros: Working for a good cause.
cons: Everything needs to be done NOW, this leads to stress and setbacks.

review_title: No accountability. Crap benefits. Bad management.
pros: Kids. Short term disability. Clean.
cons: Favoritism. Health insurance.  Management. Bullying.

pros: Open communication hospital wide from management to staff, welcoming team members, great benefits, great compensation, plenty of advancement.
cons: None at this time

pros: Great local hospital to take care of kids. It can be very rewarding sometimes. You will be able to learn a lot.
cons: Passive aggression and verbal abuse is tolerated for years before being addressed, and only then when it's causing staffing problems.

pros: Great atmosphere, flexible schedule, good benefits
cons: Amount of paid time off doesn't change from 5 to 25 years

pros: Great benefits, awesome coworkers and employees, a place that really puts children first.
cons: Parking can be a challenge

review_title: great place to and they try to work with you

pros: This is the absolute best place to work!!

pros: Very friendly work place .. I loved it

pros: Working with children is the best.
